availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel B. Capps (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Hurst Capps in Claiborne County, Tennessee, on March 17, 1842. Father to Louisa Capps, William T. Capps, Mary Ann Capps, Nancy Capps, Sarah J. Capps, Emily Capps, James B. Capps, and Nathan Capps. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860. Served in the 63rd Tennessee Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private from May 14, 1861, to August 1, 1863. Reported as deserted at Strawberry Plains, Tennessee, on August 1, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 318B-319A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 427.
Tennessee State Marriages, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Claiborne County Marriages, p. 38.
Civil War Direct Tax Assessment Lists, Tennessee, Bedford County, District 11, NARA RG 58, Series T227, Roll 1, p. 61 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Tennessee, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M268, Roll 0346.
